intro: Polycarpaea grahamii, commonly known as Graham's polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
